title: Patient Registration with Valid CPF
description: Verify that a patient can be successfully registered with a valid Brazilian CPF and that all mandatory fields are properly validated.

steps.description: Navigate to the patient registration page
Enter valid patient information including a valid CPF
Submit the registration form
Confirm the patient is saved successfully and visible in the patient list

title: Patient Registration with Invalid CPF
description: Check that patient registration fails with an invalid CPF and appropriate error messages are shown.

steps.description: Navigate to the patient registration page
Enter patient details with an invalid CPF format
Attempt to submit the registration form
Verify form validation shows an error preventing submission

title: Patient Record Editing and Data Integrity
description: Ensure patient records can be edited without losing historical clinical data or documents and changes are reflected immediately.

steps.description: Search and open an existing patient record
Modify patient details and save changes
Verify updated data is reflected and previous history remains intact

title: Patient Record Deactivation Without Data Loss
description: Verify that deactivating a patient record preserves all clinical history and documents and the record can be reactivated later.

steps.description: Locate a patient record and deactivate it
Confirm patient status is inactive but previous data remains accessible
Reactivate the same patient record
Verify patient data and history are intact after reactivation

title: Create Appointment with Conflict Validation
description: Check that creating an appointment enforces conflict detection with other appointments, respecting multi-professional and multi-room constraints.

steps.description: Open the schedule page and start creating a new appointment
Select a professional and room already booked at the same time
Attempt to save the appointment
Verify the system prevents saving and displays a conflict warning

title: Drag-and-Drop Appointment Rescheduling with Capacity Validation
description: Verify appointments can be rescheduled using drag-and-drop while validating workspace capacity and avoiding conflicts.

steps.description: In the agenda calendar, drag an appointment to a new time slot and/or room
Check if the new time and room comply with scheduling rules and capacity
Ensure conflict or capacity violations trigger warnings and prevent rescheduling

title: Set and Validate Appointment Duration and Work Schedule Configurations
description: Check that configurable session durations and work schedules are respected during appointment creation and editing.

steps.description: Access settings for session durations and work schedules
Configure durations and schedules and save changes
Create or edit an appointment to fit within new configurations
Verify appointments outside allowed settings are not accepted

title: Save SOAP Clinical Notes with Auto-Save and Digital Signature
description: Ensure that clinical SOAP notes are saved correctly, auto-save is functional, and digital signatures can be applied and verified.

steps.description: Open an existing patient’s medical record and add/modifiy SOAP notes
Wait for auto-save confirmation or manually save notes
Confirm changes are saved without data loss
Apply a digital signature to the SOAP note
Verify the signature is stored and can be viewed in audit logs

title: Interactive Pain Map Usage and EVA Scale Recording
description: Validate that users can interact with the pain map, mark pain points with EVA scale, and that inputs are saved accurately in the clinical record.

steps.description: Navigate to medical record’s pain map section
Place marks on the pain map and assign EVA pain scale values
Save the pain map data
Verify data accuracy on reload and in clinical comparisons

title: Attach Documents to SOAP Notes and Verify Audit Trail
description: Check that multiple attachments can be uploaded to clinical notes and that all actions are recorded in the audit trail.

steps.description: Add one or more document attachments to a SOAP note
Verify attachments are uploaded and accessible
Review audit trail for attachment related entries
Confirm audit logs show correct user and timestamp information

title: Exercise Prescription Filtering and Protocol Application
description: Verify that users can filter exercise library effectively and apply evidence-based protocols to patient prescriptions.

steps.description: Navigate to the exercises page
Use filters to narrow exercises by category, intensity, and body region
Verify filtered list matches criteria
Select an evidence-based protocol and apply it to a patient's prescription
Confirm protocol exercises appear in the patient's prescribed exercises

title: Track Exercise Progress and Export Reports
description: Ensure exercise progress can be tracked per patient and comprehensive reports can be exported correctly.

steps.description: View a patient’s prescribed exercises and log progress updates
Confirm progress data is saved and displayed accurately
Export exercise and progress report for the patient
Verify exported file contains correct and complete data

title: Create and Link Evaluation Forms to Patients and Sessions
description: Validate the creation of evaluation forms using templates or custom editor, and linking forms to patient records and clinical sessions.

steps.description: Open evaluation form editor and create a new form
Save and link the form to a patient and a clinical session
Confirm form appears in linked patient and session records

title: Patient Authentication and Role-Based Access Control
description: Ensure that users must authenticate and that access to modules is restricted by user role, enforcing permissions properly.

steps.description: Attempt to access a protected resource without login
Verify redirection to login or access denied
Login as receptionist and attempt to access admin-only sections
Verify access is denied
Login as administrator and access all protected modules
Verify full access is granted

title: System Performance: Page Load and API Response Times
description: Measure that critical pages load under 2 seconds and backend API endpoints respond within 500ms (P95) consistently.

steps.description: Perform page navigation to dashboard, patient list, and scheduling pages
Verify page fully loads within 2 seconds on average
Trigger common API calls such as patient search and appointment creation
Ensure 95th percentile response time is below 500ms

title: WCAG 2.1 AA Accessibility Compliance Check
description: Verify that the main user interface meets WCAG 2.1 AA standards including semantic HTML, keyboard navigation, and screen-reader compatibility.

steps.description: Audit key pages with accessibility tools
Confirm no critical accessibility issues are present
Test keyboard navigation on forms and main menus
Verify all interactive elements are reachable and operable by keyboard
Verify screen-reader announces UI components correctly

title: Audit Log Record Creation and Verification
description: Ensure that all critical actions including patient edits, appointment changes, SOAP note updates, and document uploads are logged with user and timestamp.

steps.description: Perform critical actions: edit patient, reschedule appointment, add SOAP note, upload document
Retrieve audit logs for these actions
Verify logs contain correct details including user identity, timestamps, and action descriptions
